one_reviews_text: A competely failing approach at advertising some features of a manufacturers camera...

What was the point of this exercise? What was the reasoning? Ok, putting together a camera simulator might work. But the controls are downright horrendous, you can't view the resulting images in the app, you can't focus, shutter-speed has no effect on motion blur... Why even bother? And to top it all off... A multibillion empire makes a VR app. Using the Personal Edition of the 3D engine. Not the Pro. The personal. The one that is supposed to be used for home use and educating oneself of coding...
apart from making the image darker-lighter there is nothing to this
Poor port from mobile? Environment is definitely not stunning, it's basic at most. Poor controls don't help. Too bad, as such simulator could be interesting indeed.

Can't really tell the difference between the cameras. It's unfortunate that the app is limited by the hardware of current VR headsets, but there are still many things that can be improved. Would be nice if there was more explanation and education about cameras, as to actually do what the app is supposed to do - advertise cameras. Would be great if touch support was added as well. Right now, this app has nothing to offer.
First and finally  -  You can't even select the start button. End of story.
A very poor attempt by Canon, can't imagine how this VR experience could ever be useful. Sorry 1 star
